document_name_accent: benh than kinh dai thao duong.json
document_title: Diabetic neuropathy: Signs, causes and treatment
subsection_content:
Doctor Phan Thi Thuy Dung, Department of Endocrinology - Diabetes, Tam Anh General Hospital, Ho Chi Minh City, said diabetic neuropathy is a common complication in type 1 and type 2 diabetes. High levels can damage nerves throughout the body. (first)
Depending on the location of the damaged nerve, the disease will have different symptoms. Most people with diabetes have nerve damage in their legs, symptoms include: Pain and numbness, paresthesias, tingling sensations, tingling, etc. in the legs and feet. If not treated promptly, the patient has a high risk of limb amputation. Diabetic neuropathy also causes damage to other organs such as digestion, heart, blood vessels, urinary tract, etc.
Diabetic neuropathy affects up to 50% of people with diabetes but can be prevented or slowed by good control of blood sugar levels.
subsection_title: benh than kinh dai thao duong.json. What is diabetic neuropathy?
subsection_data:
benh than kinh dai thao duong.json. What is diabetic neuropathy?
Doctor Phan Thi Thuy Dung, Department of Endocrinology - Diabetes, Tam Anh General Hospital, Ho Chi Minh City, said diabetic neuropathy is a common complication in type 1 and type 2 diabetes. High levels can damage nerves throughout the body. (first)
Depending on the location of the damaged nerve, the disease will have different symptoms. Most people with diabetes have nerve damage in their legs, symptoms include: Pain and numbness, paresthesias, tingling sensations, tingling, etc. in the legs and feet. If not treated promptly, the patient has a high risk of limb amputation. Diabetic neuropathy also causes damage to other organs such as digestion, heart, blood vessels, urinary tract, etc.
Diabetic neuropathy affects up to 50% of people with diabetes but can be prevented or slowed by good control of blood sugar levels.
